description: Borrowed from Telugu పందికొక్కు (pandikokku), from పంది (pandi, “pig, boar”) +‎ కొక్కు (kokku, “bandicoot”).

entries.meaning: A small Australian marsupial with a distinctive long snout, of the family Peramelidae (with the exception of genus Macrotis, called bilbies).
Any of several rat-like rodents of the genera Bandicota and Nesokia of southeast Asia.

verbs.description: bandicoot (third-person singular simple present bandicoots, present participle bandicooting, simple past and past participle bandicooted)

entries.meaning: (Australia, informal) To steal growing vegetables from a garden
